Title: Dow Jones Today: Stock Indexes Set Fresh Records Ahead of Fed Interest-Rate Decision, Big Tech Earnings; Nvidia Hits $5 Trillion Market Cap
Description: Major stock indexes hit fresh records Wednesday ahead of the Federal Reserve's decision on interest rates and earnings reports from several tech giants, while Nvidia became the first company to have a $5 trillion valuation.
Publish Time: unknown
Content: By

[Aaron Rennie](https://www.investopedia.com/aaron-rennie-8603747)

![Image 1: Aaron Rennie](https://www.investopedia.com/thmb/NVXx6Qf0_i9siu3_kIGq9R3N0zw=/200x200/filters:no_upscale():max_bytes(150000):strip_icc():format(webp)/AR-29-Final2-e94078b0a8724bc583a3e8e68b668616-7a83a042ecc543a68387b9202a62542f.jpg)

A former Senior Publishing Editor on the Dow Jones Newswires team at The Wall Street Journal, Aaron earned a Bachelor's degree in Economics from the University of Michigan and a Master's in Journalism from Columbia University.

Updated October 29, 2025

10:43 AM EDT

Major stock indexes set all-time highs for a fourth straight session Wednesday.
Michael M. Santiago / Getty Images

URL: https://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/nvidia-announces-financial-results-for-second-quarter-fiscal-2026
Title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Second Quarter Fiscal 2026
Description: NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) today reported revenue for the second quarter ended July 27, 2025, of $46.7 billion, up 6% from the previous quarter and up 56% from a year ago. NVIDIA’s Blackwell Data Center revenue grew 17% sequentially.
Publish Time: unknown
Content: NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) today reported revenue for the second quarter ended July 27, 2025, of $46.7 billion, up 6% from the previous quarter and up 56% from a year ago. NVIDIA’s Blackwell Data Center revenue grew 17% sequentially.

There were no H20 sales to China-based customers in the second quarter.NVIDIA benefited from a $180 million release of previously reserved H20 inventory, from approximately $650 million in unrestricted H20 sales to a customer outside of China.

For the quarter, GAAP and non-GAAP gross margins were 72.4% and 72.7%, respectively. Excluding the $180 million release, non-GAAP gross margin for the quarter would have been 72.3%.

For the quarter, GAAP and non-GAAP earnings per diluted share were $1.08 and $1.05, respectively. Excluding the $180 million release and related tax impact, non-GAAP diluted earnings per share for the quarter would have been $1.04.

URL: https://www.investors.com/research/investing-action-plan/apple-google-meta-amazon-microsoft-earnings-fed-rate-cut-trump-xi-ahead/
Title: Apple, Google, Meta, Amazon, Microsoft Earnings Due; Fed Rate Cut, Trump-Xi Ahead
Description: Apple, Microsoft, Meta, Amazon and Google results and guidance have massive market implications. But there's so much on tap.
Publish Time: 2025-10-24T17:15:42+00:00
Content: The stock market is at record highs heading into peak earnings week, with **Apple** ([AAPL](https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL)), Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Google and Amazon all on tap. The Federal Reserve is expected to cut rates for a second straight meeting. President Donald Trump is set to meet President Xi Jinping with a China trade deal apparentlyclose..

Capital spending plans from **Microsoft** ([MSFT](https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT)), **Meta Platforms** ([META](https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=META)), **Amazon.com** ([AMZN](https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AMZN)) and Google parent **Alphabet** ([GOOGL](https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=GOOGL)) will be hugely important for the AI boom, which is leading the stock market rally and overall economy.

Dozens of other notable companies also will be reporting.

Tesla Leads Stocks To Watch
